citations.narrative:
The cage carpets used at the facility as whelping mats are in disrepair. Six enclosures housing
five adult dogs and 16 puppies, contain cage carpets that have frayed edges that expose loose fibers and long strings.
Frayed carpet edges can potentially be dangerous, as the dogs could chew on or ingest the carpet fibers, or they may
wrap around the extremities of the dogs resulting in injury. Correct by ensuring that all materials used in the kennels, such
as carpeting, are closely monitored and replaced when worn, to avoid the potential for injury. Additionally, the licensee
must ensure that all surfaces in contact with the dogs are able to be cleaned and sanitized in accordance with 3.11(b) of
this subpart or replaced when worn or soiled.

The facility does not have the date recorded for the administration of the rabies vaccine in the adult dogs. Failure to
maintain records of vaccines and treatments administered to the dogs does not allow for APHIS officials to determine if
the veterinarian approved vaccination schedule is being followed. Correct by ensuring that the names of all vaccines and
treatments administered and the dates of administration are recorded.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 15-July-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
